net.sf.mmm.util.event.base

Class AbstractEventBus

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractComponent
      • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableComponent
        • net.sf.mmm.util.event.base.AbstractEventBus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventBus
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EventBusImpl

    public abstract class AbstractEventBus
extends AbstractLoggableComponent
implements EventBus
    This is the default implementation of EventBus. It is compatible to work in limited environments such as GWT.
    Since:
    5.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  AbstractEventBus.EventDispatcher<E>
      A dispatcher for all EventListeners of a particular event type.
      protected static class  AbstractEventBus.EventListenerContainer<E>
      A simple container for a registered EventListener.

        The constructor.

      • AbstractEventBus

        public AbstractEventBus(QueueFactory queueFactory,
                        MapFactory<?> mapFactory)
        The constructor.
        Parameters:
        queueFactory - is the factory used to create simple Queues for Event s and EventListeners.
        mapFactory - is the factory used to create Maps.

public void setGlobalExceptionHandler(GlobalExceptionHandler errorHandler)
        Parameters:

      • sendEvent

        public <E> void sendEvent(E event)
        Description copied from interface: EventBus
        This method sends an event to all registered listeners.
        Specified by:
        sendEvent in interface EventBus
        Type Parameters:
        E - is the generic type of the Event to send. May be any Object such as a String. However in most cases it is recommended to create real Event classes.
        Parameters:
        event - is the event to send. May be any Object such as a String. However in most cases it is recommended to create real Event classes.

      • triggerDispatchEvents

        protected abstract void triggerDispatchEvents()
        Called from sendEvent(Object) to ensure dispatchEvents() is triggered. This can be done synchronous or asynchronous.

      • dispatchEvents

        protected void dispatchEvents()
        Dispatches all events in the event queue.

      • dispatchEvent

        protected <E> void dispatchEvent(E event,
                                 Collection<Throwable> errors)
        Dispatches the given Event.
        Type Parameters:
        E - is the generic type of event.
        Parameters:
        event - is the Event to dispatch.
        errors - is a Collection where errors are collected.

      • handleUndispatchedEvent

        protected void handleUndispatchedEvent(Object event)
        Called if an Event was send but not dispatched to any registered listener.
        Parameters:
        event - is the un-dispatched event.

      • handleErrors

        protected void handleErrors(Collection<Throwable> errors,
                            Object event)
        This method is called if errors occurred while dispatching events.
        Parameters:
        errors - is the Collection with the errors. Will NOT be empty.
        event - is the event that has been send and caused the errors.

      • getEventDispatcherRequired

        protected <E> AbstractEventBus.EventDispatcher<E> getEventDispatcherRequired(Class<E> eventType)
        Gets or creates the AbstractEventBus.EventDispatcher for the given eventType.
        Type Parameters:
        E - is the generic type of eventType.
        Parameters:
        eventType - is the Class reflecting the event.
        Returns:
        the AbstractEventBus.EventDispatcher responsible for the given eventType.

      • getEventDispatcherOptional

        protected <E> AbstractEventBus.EventDispatcher<? super E> getEventDispatcherOptional(Class<E> eventType)
        Gets the most specific AbstractEventBus.EventDispatcher responsible the given eventType.
        Type Parameters:
        E - is the generic type of eventType.
        Parameters:
        eventType - is the Class reflecting the event.
        Returns:
        the most specific AbstractEventBus.EventDispatcher responsible for the given eventType. May be null if no EventListener is registered for a compatible eventType.

      • getEventDispatcher

        private AbstractEventBus.EventDispatcher getEventDispatcher(Class<?> eventType,
                                                            boolean createIfNotExists)
        Gets or creates the AbstractEventBus.EventDispatcher for the given eventType.
        Parameters:
        eventType - is the Class reflecting the event.
        createIfNotExists - - if true the requested AbstractEventBus.EventDispatcher will be created if it does not exists, if false this method will return null if it does not exist.
        Returns:
        the AbstractEventBus.EventDispatcher responsible for the given eventType. May be null if createIfNotExists is null and not available.

      • addListener

        public <E> void addListener(Class<E> eventType,
                            EventListener<E> listener)
        Description copied from interface: EventBus
        This method registers a listener that is interested in Events.
        Specified by:
        addListener in interface EventBus
        Type Parameters:
        E - is the generic type of the Events to listen to. May be any Object such as a String. However in most cases it is recommended to create real Event classes.
        Parameters:
        eventType - is the type of the Events to listen to (including all derived types). In limited environments such as GWT, interfaces might not be supported.
        listener - is the listener to add.

      • removeListener

        public boolean removeListener(EventListener<?> listener)
        Description copied from interface: EventBus
        This method removes a listener. If the listener was not registered before this method will have no effect.
        Specified by:
        removeListener in interface EventBus
        Parameters:
        listener - is the listener to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the given listener has successfully been removed, false if the listener was NOT registered.
